p: The “Fridays for Future” movement has resulted in the largest climate protests in history, with actions in over 7500 cities around the world. As the “new ambassadors for scientific consensus and climate mitigation,” adolescents are at the forefront of the movement to hold governments and industries accountable for their emissions.35 Many young people, however, assert that their inclusion in global platforms, such as the UN Framework Convention on Climate Change conferences, has been tokenistic rather than a serious attempt to respond to their views.36
